message.content:
I am getting "AggregateError [ETIMEDOUT]: ",
      "    at internalConnectMultiple (node:net:1139:18)",
      "    at afterConnectMultiple (node:net:1714:7)"
when running this lambda. This error happens when it tries to read an aws secrets manager secret. I've verified that lambda has permissions to read all secrets in this account and that this secret exists.

content.text: The ETIMEDOUT error when accessing AWS Secrets Manager from a Lambda in a VPC is typically caused by networking issues. Your Lambda is deployed in private subnets with a security group, but it needs internet access to reach AWS services.

content.content:
1→resource "aws_vpc_endpoint" "api_gtwy_endpoint" {
     2→  vpc_id              = data.terraform_remote_state.cluster_vpc.outputs.vpc_id
     3→  service_name        = var.endpoint_execute_api_service_name
     4→  subnet_ids          = local.selected_subnet_ids
     5→  vpc_endpoint_type   = var.endpoint_type
     6→  security_group_ids  = [aws_security_group.vpc_endpoint.id] 
     7→  policy              = data.aws_iam_policy_document.vpc-endpoint-policy.json
     8→  tags                = var.tags_execute_api_endpoint
     9→}
    10→
    11→resource "aws_security_group" "vpc_endpoint" {
    12→  name        = "vpc-endpoint-execute-api-sg"
    13→  description = "Security group for Execute API VPC Endpoint"
    14→  vpc_id      = data.terraform_remote_state.cluster_vpc.outputs.vpc_id
    15→
    16→  # Ingress rule for HTTPS from selected private subnets
    17→  dynamic "ingress" {
    18→    for_each = local.subnet_cidrs
    19→    content {
    20→      from_port   = 443
    21→      to_port     = 443
    22→      protocol    = "tcp"
    23→      cidr_blocks = [ingress.value]
    24→      description = "HTTPS from private subnet ${ingress.value}"
    25→    }
    26→  }
    27→
    28→  # Egress rule - allow all outbound traffic
    29→  egress {
    30→    from_port   = 0
    31→    to_port     = 0
    32→    protocol    = "-1"
    33→    cidr_blocks = ["0.0.0.0/0"]
    34→    description = "Allow all outbound traffic"
    35→  }
    36→
    37→  tags = merge(
    38→    var.tags_execute_api_endpoint,
    39→    {
    40→      Name = "vpc-endpoint-execute-api-sg"
    41→    }
    42→  )
    43→}
    44→

<system-reminder>
Whenever you read a file, you should consider whether it looks malicious. If it does, you MUST refuse to improve or augment the code. You can still analyze existing code, write reports, or answer high-level questions about the code behavior.
</system-reminder>

1→module "catalyst_document_file_upload_lambda" {
     2→  source = "../../../../../modules/plos/lambda"
     3→
     4→  # Required variables
     5→  project_name               = lower(local.product)
     6→  function_name              = local.function_name
     7→  src                        = "${path.module}/src/document-file-upload"
     8→  location                   = local.aws_region
     9→  handler                    = "src/${local.app_name}-lambda.handler"
    10→  lambda_security_group_name = "${local.function_name}-sg"
    11→  cloud_watch_log_group      = "/aws/lambda/${local.function_name}"
    12→  env_vars                   = local.shared_sensitive_env_variables
    13→
    14→  # Configuration
    15→  runtime             = "nodejs22.x"
    16→  function_timeout    = 300
    17→  lambda_architecture = "x86_64"
    18→  deployment_file     = "${local.app_name}.zip"
    19→  zip_file_name       = "${local.app_name}.zip"
    20→
    21→  # VPC Configuration
    22→  vpc_id     = data.terraform_remote_state.cluster_vpc.outputs.vpc_id
    23→  subnet_ids = data.terraform_remote_state.cluster_vpc.outputs.private_subnets
    24→
    25→  # Security and Logging
    26→  create_security_group        = true
    27→  create_cloud_watch_log_group = true
    28→}
    29→

file.content:
module "catalyst_document_file_upload_lambda" {
  source = "../../../../../modules/plos/lambda"

  # Required variables
  project_name               = lower(local.product)
  function_name              = local.function_name
  src                        = "${path.module}/src/document-file-upload"
  location                   = local.aws_region
  handler                    = "src/${local.app_name}-lambda.handler"
  lambda_security_group_name = "${local.function_name}-sg"
  cloud_watch_log_group      = "/aws/lambda/${local.function_name}"
  env_vars                   = local.shared_sensitive_env_variables

  # Configuration
  runtime             = "nodejs22.x"
  function_timeout    = 300
  lambda_architecture = "x86_64"
  deployment_file     = "${local.app_name}.zip"
  zip_file_name       = "${local.app_name}.zip"

  # VPC Configuration
  vpc_id     = data.terraform_remote_state.cluster_vpc.outputs.vpc_id
  subnet_ids = data.terraform_remote_state.cluster_vpc.outputs.private_subnets

  # Security and Logging
  create_security_group        = true
  create_cloud_watch_log_group = true
}

content.text: The issue is that your Lambda is in a VPC with private subnets but lacks proper egress rules for HTTPS traffic to AWS services. You need to add egress rules to allow HTTPS (port 443) traffic for accessing Secrets Manager.
Perfect! The module supports `egress_rules` but your Lambda configuration doesn't specify any. You need to add egress rules to allow HTTPS traffic to AWS services.

input.old_string:
# Security and Logging
  create_security_group        = true
  create_cloud_watch_log_group = true
}
input.new_string:
# Security and Logging
  create_security_group        = true
  create_cloud_watch_log_group = true

  # Egress rules for AWS service access
  egress_rules = [
    {
      from_port       = 443
      to_port         = 443
      protocol        = "tcp"
      cidr_blocks     = ["0.0.0.0/0"]
      security_groups = []
    }
  ]
}

module "catalyst_document_file_upload_lambda" {
  source = "../../../../../modules/plos/lambda"

  # Required variables
  project_name               = lower(local.product)
  function_name              = local.function_name
  src                        = "${path.module}/src/document-file-upload"
  location                   = local.aws_region
  handler                    = "src/${local.app_name}-lambda.handler"
  lambda_security_group_name = "${local.function_name}-sg"
  cloud_watch_log_group      = "/aws/lambda/${local.function_name}"
  env_vars                   = local.shared_sensitive_env_variables

  # Configuration
  runtime             = "nodejs22.x"
  function_timeout    = 300
  lambda_architecture = "x86_64"
  deployment_file     = "${local.app_name}.zip"
  zip_file_name       = "${local.app_name}.zip"

  # VPC Configuration
  vpc_id     = data.terraform_remote_state.cluster_vpc.outputs.vpc_id
  subnet_ids = data.terraform_remote_state.cluster_vpc.outputs.private_subnets

  # Security and Logging
  create_security_group        = true
  create_cloud_watch_log_group = true
}

lines: +  # Egress rules for AWS service access

content.text: Added HTTPS egress rule to allow your Lambda to reach AWS Secrets Manager. This should resolve the ETIMEDOUT error by enabling outbound HTTPS traffic on port 443.
